user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_create_response_from_buffer_copy:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_from_buffer_copy (size_t size,
                                      const void *buffer)
{
  struct MHD_Response *r;
  void *mhd_copy;

  if (0 == size)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (0,
                                                                   NULL,
                                                                   NULL,
                                                                   NULL);
  if (NULL == buffer)
    return NULL;

  mhd_copy = malloc (size);
  if (NULL == mhd_copy)
    return NULL;
  memcpy (mhd_copy, buffer, size);

  r = MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (size,
                                                              mhd_copy,
                                                              &free,
                                                              mhd_copy);
  if (NULL == r)
    free (mhd_copy);
  else
  {
    /* TODO: remove the next assignment, the buffer should not be modifiable */
    r->data_buffer_size = size;
  }

  return r;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No function parameter is modified in this function. The parameters are: (1) size (type size_t) — it is only read and passed by value to other functions and used to allocate and initialize data; there is no assignment, increment/decrement, or other modification of the variable 'size' itself. (2) buffer (type const void *) — it is only used as the source argument to memcpy and tested for NULL; the pointer itself is not assigned to or altered, and the const qualifier prevents modifying the object it points to. All other assignments affect local variables (mhd_copy, r) or members of the response object (r->data_buffer_size), not the incoming parameters. Therefore there are no fragments that violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 in the provided code.
